Yes, it is truly remarkable how the Nez Perce people have been able to adapt and maintain their cultural practices and beliefs despite centuries of colonization, forced removal from their land, and other forms of cultural oppression. This resilience is a testament to the strength and determination of the Nez Perce people, as well as to the importance of cultural traditions and spiritual heritage in the face of adversity.

Today, the Nez Perce people continue to value their cultural heritage and practices, and they strive to balance the preservation of their traditional ways with the demands of modern life. This includes the ongoing challenge of passing down cultural knowledge and practices to younger generations, as well as finding ways to adapt traditional practices to modern contexts. Overall, the Nez Perce people's ability to adapt and thrive in the face of cultural change is inspiring, and serves as a reminder of the importance of preserving and valuing indigenous cultures and ways of life.
